FlowGraph
Table of Contents

Class CanvasRenderModel

Namespace
FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering
Assembly
FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll

Central model that calculates all rendering geometry for a graph. This is the single source of truth for node bounds, port positions, edge paths, etc. Both VisualTree rendering and DirectDraw rendering use this model to ensure 100% visual parity.

public class CanvasRenderModel
Inheritance
object
CanvasRenderModel
Inherited Members
object.Equals(object)
object.Equals(object, object)
object.GetHashCode()
object.GetType()
object.MemberwiseClone()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)
object.ToString()

Examples

var model = new GraphRenderModel(settings);

// Get node bounds in canvas coordinates
var bounds = model.GetNodeBounds(node);

// Get port position
var portPos = model.GetPortPosition(node, port, isOutput: true);

// Calculate edge endpoints
var (start, end) = model.GetEdgeEndpoints(edge, graph);

Remarks

The GraphRenderModel provides geometry calculations for:

  • Node bounds and dimensions
  • Port positions (supporting all 4 sides: Left, Right, Top, Bottom)
  • Edge endpoints and bezier control points
  • Group header and collapse button positions
  • Resize handle positions
  • Hit testing utilities

By centralizing all geometry calculations here, both the visual tree renderer (NodeVisualManager) and the direct renderer (DirectCanvasRenderer) produce identical visual output.
